intro: Lasiandra macrantha rosea, commonly known as the pink-flowered lasiandra, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae and is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, winged fruits that aid in seed dispersal. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
